channel.title: BUscience
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUscience, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A tiny embryo fold changed the course of evolution
item.description: A small tissue fold in fly embryos, once thought purposeless, plays a vital role in stabilizing tissues. Researchers show that it absorbs stress durin...

item.title: Fossil reveals a 310-million-year-old fish that ate with a hidden second jaw
item.description: Scientists uncovered a 310-million-year-old fish fossil with a “tongue bite,” teeth on the roof and floor of its mouth that worked like a second jaw. ...

item.title: A 3-minute brainwave test could spot Alzheimer’s years before symptoms
item.description: Scientists at the University of Bath have developed a simple three-minute brainwave test called Fastball EEG that can detect memory problems years bef...

item.title: Scientists watch an atomic nucleus flip in real time
item.description: Scientists at Delft University of Technology have managed to watch a single atomic nucleus flip its magnetic state in real time. Using a scanning tunn...

item.title: Scientists create biodegradable plastic stronger than PET
item.description: A Japanese research team successfully harnessed E. coli to produce PDCA, a strong, biodegradable plastic alternative. Their method avoids toxic byprod...
